metadata.title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because theXkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting inout-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. Thisissue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X serveris running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xnest - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xserver-common - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xvfb - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
xwayland - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

xmir-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
xorg-server-source-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
xserver-xephyr-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
xwayland-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.12+esm5').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.6+esm4').
